meanings.definition: Attractive or pleasing to the senses or mind.
meanings.sent1: The colorful flowers in the garden were very appealing to me.
meanings.sent2: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies was very appealing to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog was so appealing that it made me laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like an appealing melody that captivated everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The stunning sunset painted an appealing picture in the sky.

meanings.definition: Evoking a positive response; inviting or engaging.
meanings.sent1: The friendly smile on her face was very appealing to the new students.
meanings.sent2: The exciting movie trailer was so appealing that it made me want to watch the film.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a penguin wearing a top hat was so appealing that it made me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His words were like an appealing invitation to explore a new world of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The warm, cozy fireplace created an appealing atmosphere in the room.

meanings.definition: Having the power to attract or interest.
meanings.sent1: The shiny new toy was very appealing to the young child.
meanings.sent2: The intriguing mystery novel was so appealing that I couldn't put it down.
meanings.sent3: The thought of a flying pig was so appealing that it brought a smile to my face.
meanings.sent4: Her intelligence was like an appealing magnet that drew people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The captivating magic show put on an appealing display of illusions.
